div.p: MRS 203/2, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921, 90/255. Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney

Amongst my collection from the coast are some Fungi and Algae, specimens of which it would perhaps be better, to send to Baron von Muller directly , if you do not object, by directly I mean without sending them to the Museum first, though of course I have put by duplicates (the best) for the Museum also. I have also now better flowering specimens of the beautiful red drooping Eriostemon, which looks so much like a Darwinia; some of those might also be sent to him directly , as he has the former specimens still in his hands for determination. If the species proves new, as I think it will, I should ask the Baron not to name it after Mr . Combes,
Cowbes?
as he proposed at the time. Perhaps you Sir might suggest the name of some gentleman or other who could or would further the interests of the department. There is also a Grevillea, which may prove new. What I wish to know first is; whether I may forward those specimens directly to him. Of course the best Herbarium specimens of the species in question will go to the Museum. […]
